ticket.title: MassAssignment problem with ActiveRecord 2.3.9
ticket.original-body:
Hi, i have a problem with ActiveRecord 2.3.9, the massassignment doesn't work. New Database entry is nil for all parameters. If i use ActiveRecord 2.3.5 everything works fine. Anybody an idea if there is a bug?
@@@ #ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(...) #class Tag < ActiveRecord::Base;end Tag.create(...) Tag.find(:all) @@@
Thanks, astrid

@@@ #ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(...) #class Tag < ActiveRecord::Base;end Tag.create(...) Tag.find(:all) @@@
Thanks, astrid
ticket.original-body-html:
Hi,
i have a problem with ActiveRecord 2.3.9, the massassignment doesn't
work. New Database entry is nil for all parameters.
If i use ActiveRecord 2.3.5 everything works fine.
Anybody an idea if there is a bug?

#ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(...)
#class Tag < ActiveRecord::Base;end
Tag.create(...)
Tag.find(:all)

Thanks,
astrid

version.body: Can you please give us a code sample we can run that demonstrates the problem you're having? I'll put this one on need-more-info for now. :)

version.title: MassAssignment problem with ActiveRecord 2.3.9

version.body: NEW DELHI, Wednesday 13 October 2010 (AFP) - India has botched up a patriotic publicity drive heralding the success of the country's Gucci evening dress in the 2010 Delhi Commonwealth Games.
version.body-html: NEW DELHI, Wednesday 13 October 2010 (AFP) - India has botched up a patriotic publicity drive heralding the success of the country's Gucci evening dress in the 2010 Delhi Commonwealth Games.
version.title: MassAssignment problem with ActiveRecord 2.3.9

version.body:
The model: class Tag < ActiveRecord::Base end
connection: ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection( :adapter => 'sqlite3', :database => 'test.sqlite3.db' )
call: Tag.create(:description => "test", :typpe => "some")
if using ActiveRecord 2.3.9 Tag.find(:all) gives me the entry with :description => nil and typpe => nil
If using ActiveRecord 2.3.5 Tag.find(:all) gives me the entry with :description => "test" and typpe => "some"
so you only need the Model and the create method to try out the behavior
I hope this helps
version.body-html:
The model:
class Tag < ActiveRecord::Base
end

connection:
ActiveRecord::Base.establish_connection(
:adapter => 'sqlite3', :database => 'test.sqlite3.db' )

call:
Tag.create(:description => "test", :typpe => "some")

if using ActiveRecord 2.3.9
Tag.find(:all) gives me the entry with :description => nil and typpe => nil

If using ActiveRecord 2.3.5
Tag.find(:all) gives me the entry with :description => "test" and typpe => "some"

so you only need the Model and the create method to try out the behavior

I hope this helps
version.title: MassAssignment problem with ActiveRecord 2.3.9

version.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not been commented on for at least three months.
The resources of the Rails core team are limited, and so we are asking for your help. If you can still reproduce this error on the 3-0-stable branch or on master, please reply with all of the information you have about it and add "[state:open]" to your comment. This will reopen the ticket for review. Likewise, if you feel that this is a very important feature for Rails to include, please reply with your explanation so we can consider it.
Thank you for all your contributions, and we hope you will understand this step to focus our efforts where they are most helpful.
